title: Data Center of Excellence - Manager
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. TEAM OVERVIEW
KKR’s Global Market Operations team is comprised of the Client Services Team (CST), Treasury, Private Market Operations, Data Operations, and Global Credit Investment Operations teams. Overall, the Global Market Operations team is responsible for ensuring compliance and best practices for treasury activities, implementation of technology for process improvements, and identifying value creation opportunities. The team also liaises with clients, internal stakeholders, and team members to effectively and accurately communicate relevant issues and solutions.
POSITION SUMMARY
KKR is building out an enterprise Data Operations group to collect, manage, and harness the power of data across our diverse business activities. The Data Operations Center of Excellence (CoE) is a cross functional team dedicated to formulating & driving KKR’s enterprise data management strategy while also providing the operating leverage required to bring these strategies/ frameworks to life. The Data Ops CoE will consists of 3 focus areas (pillars); Data Governance, Data Quality and Data Delivery.
We are hiring a data delivery lead to partner with business teams and the head of data delivery to identify critical data reporting/ analytics use-cases and work closely alongside Engineering colleagues to design & deliver sustainable and extensible analytics & reporting capabilities, with an emphasis on enabling self-service across the firm. This individual will also play a leading role in the curation of data-sets to be published for data exploration and self-service through this central data platform, helping establish a standardized & accessible enterprise data model. Lastly, the data delivery lead will leverage the central data platform to deliver advanced data & analytics use-cases for our business partners (e.g. sentiment analytics, scenario analysis, back-testing/ optimization, quantitative modeling, etc.).
The ideal candidate would have experience designing enterprise data platforms, operationally supporting such a platform, and the ability to deliver advanced analytics use-cases across domains. This role requires the unique combination of asset/ investment management knowledge, organizational leadership/ people management skills, and hands on technical ability to deliver analytics solutions. 
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Operational Excellence

Develop data applications in conjunction with other technical teams to solve data centric business use cases, i.e. automation
Curate data-sets across domains (‘Data Products’) to be published in the central data platform for end-user exploration & access; working closely with Data Governance colleagues to ensure data-sets meet standards for publication
Identify advanced data & analytics use-cases across the firm (e.g. sentiment analytics, scenario analysis, back-testing/ optimization, quantitative modeling, etc.) and lead delivery thereof, both owning the requisite modeling but also ensuring the central platform has the capabilities to support these use-cases. You will be expected to work end to end on these use cases including development where necessary.
Understand and document data and use case requirements for a variety of business needs
Create and maintain reporting functionality as per business needs
Execute and manage ad hoc data related projects within specified deadlines

Stakeholder Management

Collaborate with platform engineering teams to support and make recommendations for enhanced digital reporting capabilities and data platform tools
Communicate and work closely with relevant teams to close data gaps in a clear and timely manner
Serve as point of contact for data-related questions and updates from various internal and external groups, delivering ad-hoc analytics to answer key business questions in a timely manner

Reporting & Governance

Design and document standard operating procedures for data management
Implement and own best in class data governance practices; ensuring that data is well defined & transparently documented

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience required
4-6 years of data operation experience in financial services
Experience in a multinational Financial Services organization and/or Private Equity preferred
Experience working with complex data sets in a programming language such as Python
Ability to adhere to the compliance requirements of processes
Advanced analytical & data visualization capabilities using a programming language such as Python.
Extremely strong technical skills, with hands on ability to develop solutions in multiple computing languages and develop complex models/ algorithms (python, SQL, Spark, JavaScript, C++, HTML/ CSS, etc.)
Displays high attention to detail
Demonstrates outstanding initiative and strong work ethic
Focuses on delivery excellence and accountability
Displays team-work orientation and is highly collaborative
Displays strong integrity and professionalism
Builds strong relationships with local and global colleagues
Demonstrates strong track record in accuracy and organization
Demonstrates excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
KKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
